title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A classic novel about racial injustice and the loss of innocence in a small Southern town.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian regime and the struggle for freedom and individuality.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic love story set in the English countryside, exploring themes of class, marriage, and societal expectations.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A tale of wealth, love, and the American Dream in the Roaring Twenties.

title: To the Lighthouse
author: Virginia Woolf
description: A stream-of-consciousness novel that explores the inner lives of its characters and the passage of time.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel set in a future world where conformity and pleasure are prioritized.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Bronte
description: A Gothic novel exploring the journey of a young woman's search for love, independence, and belonging.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age story that follows a teenage protagonist's disillusionment with the adult world.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsession with hunting down the great white whale.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A high fantasy trilogy that follows the quest to destroy a powerful ring and save Middle-earth from darkness.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy adventure about a hobbit's journey to reclaim a treasure guarded by a dragon.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the popular Harry Potter series, introducing the magical world of Hogwarts.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel about a young shepherd's journey to find his personal legend.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A thriller that combines art, history, and religion in a quest for a hidden secret.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An ancient Greek epic poem that follows the hero Odysseus' journey back home after the Trojan War.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A novel exploring themes of creation, identity, and the consequences of playing god.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A story about a man whose portrait ages while he remains forever young, capturing the essence of his corruption.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
description: A series of fantasy novels set in the magical world of Narnia and the adventures of its inhabitants.

title: Gone with the Wind
author: Margaret Mitchell
description: A historical novel set during the American Civil War, depicting the struggles and romances of its characters.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: A dystopian series where young tributes fight for survival in a televised event.
